intro: Grewiopsis dewevrei, commonly known as the African dewevrei, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
